meanings.sent1: I faxed the contract to the office.
meanings.sent2: She faxed the report to her boss.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally faxed a paw print to the wrong number.
meanings.sent4: His words were faxed across the room, reaching everyone instantly.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message was faxed with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: Transmit (a document) electronically using a fax machine.
meanings.sent1: They faxed the important papers to the client.
meanings.sent2: We need to fax the signed agreement to the head office.
meanings.sent3: The robot faxed a birthday card to its inventor.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were faxed to him without a single word spoken.
meanings.sent5: The image was faxed with perfect clarity.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I received a faxed document.
meanings.sent2: The faxed message was clear and easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a faxed clue at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like faded faxed pages from the past.
meanings.sent5: The faxed paper held secrets of a bygone era.
